section: C:/Users/kemik/git/lvgl_t113/lv_conf.h 浏览该文件的文档.00001 00006 /* 00007 * Copy this file as `lv_conf.h` 00008 * 1. simply next to the `lvgl` folder 00009 * 2. or any other places and 00010 * - define `LV_CONF_INCLUDE_SIMPLE` 00011 * - add the path as include path 00012 */ 00013 00014 /* clang-format off */ 00015 #if 1 /*Set it to "1" to enable content*/ 00016 00017 #ifndef LV_CONF_H 00018 #define LV_CONF_H 00019 00020 #include <stdint.h> 00021 /* UI rotation: 00022 * - 0: no rotate 00023 * - 1: 90° 00024 * - 2: 180° 00025 * - 3: 270° 00026 */ 00027 00028 #define LV_UI_ROTATE_DIRECTION 2 00029 00030 /*==================== 00031 COLOR SETTINGS 00032 *====================*/ 00033 00034 /*Color depth: 1 (1 byte per pixel), 8 (RGB332), 16 (RGB565), 32 (ARGB8888)*/ 00035 #define LV_COLOR_DEPTH 32 00036 00037 /*Swap the 2 bytes of RGB565 color. Useful if the display has an 8-bit interface (e.g. SPI)*/ 00038 #define LV_COLOR_16_SWAP 0 00039 00040 /*Enable features to draw on transparent background. 00041 *It's required if opa, and transform_* style properties are used. 00042 *Can be also used if the UI is above another layer, e.g. an OSD menu or video player.*/ 00043 #define LV_COLOR_SCREEN_TRANSP 0 00044 00045 /* Adjust color mix functions rounding. GPUs might calculate color mix (blending) differently. 00046 * 0: round down, 64: round up from x.75, 128: round up from half, 192: round up from x.25, 254: round up */ 00047 #define LV_COLOR_MIX_ROUND_OFS 0 00048 00049 /*Images pixels with this color will not be drawn if they are chroma keyed)*/ 00050 #define LV_COLOR_CHROMA_KEY lv_color_hex(0x00ff00) /*pure green*/ 00051 00052 /*========================= 00053 MEMORY SETTINGS 00054 *=========================*/ 00055 00056 /*1: use custom malloc/free, 0: use the built-in `lv_mem_alloc()` and `lv_mem_free()`*/ 00057 #define LV_MEM_CUSTOM 0 00058 #if LV_MEM_CUSTOM == 0 00059 /*Size of the memory available for `lv_mem_alloc()` in bytes (>= 2kB)*/ 00060 #define LV_MEM_SIZE (128U * 1024U) /*[bytes]*/ 00061 00062 /*Set an address for the memory pool instead of allocating it as a normal array. Can be in external SRAM too.*/ 00063 #define LV_MEM_ADR 0 /*0: unused*/ 00064 /*Instead of an address give a memory allocator that will be called to get a memory pool for LVGL. E.g. my_malloc*/ 00065 #if LV_MEM_ADR == 0 00066 #undef LV_MEM_POOL_INCLUDE 00067 #undef LV_MEM_POOL_ALLOC 00068 #endif 00069 00070 #else /*LV_MEM_CUSTOM*/ 00071 #define LV_MEM_CUSTOM_INCLUDE <stdlib.h> /*Header for the dynamic memory function*/ 00072 #define LV_MEM_CUSTOM_ALLOC malloc 00073 #define LV_MEM_CUSTOM_FREE free 00074 #define LV_MEM_CUSTOM_REALLOC realloc 00075 #endif /*LV_MEM_CUSTOM*/ 00076 00077 /*Number of the intermediate memory buffer used during rendering and other internal processing mechanisms. 00078 *You will see an error log message if there wasn't enough buffers. */ 00079 #define LV_MEM_BUF_MAX_NUM 16 00080 00081 /*Use the standard `memcpy` and `memset` instead of LVGL's own functions. (Might or might not be faster).*/ 00082 #define LV_MEMCPY_MEMSET_STD 0 00083 00084 /*==================== 00085 HAL SETTINGS 00086 *====================*/ 00087 00088 /*Default display refresh period. LVG will redraw changed areas with this period time*/ 00089 #define LV_DISP_DEF_REFR_PERIOD 17 /*[ms]*/ 00090 00091 /*Input device read period in milliseconds*/ 00092 #define LV_INDEV_DEF_READ_PERIOD 17 /*[ms]*/ 00093 00094 /*Use a custom tick source that tells the elapsed time in milliseconds. 00095 *It removes the need to manually update the tick with `lv_tick_inc()`)*/ 00096 #define LV_TICK_CUSTOM 1 00097 #if LV_TICK_CUSTOM 00098 uint32_t custom_tick_get(void); 00099 #define LV_TICK_CUSTOM_INCLUDE <stdint.h> /*Header for the system time function*/ 00100 #define LV_TICK_CUSTOM_SYS_TIME_EXPR (custom_tick_get()) /*Expression evaluating to current system time in ms*/ 00101 #endif /*LV_TICK_CUSTOM*/ 00102 00103 /*Default Dot Per Inch. Used to initialize default sizes such as widgets sized, style paddings. 00104 *(Not so important, you can adjust it to modify default sizes and spaces)*/ 00105 #define LV_DPI_DEF 130 /*[px/inch]*/ 00106 00107 /*======================= 00108 * FEATURE CONFIGURATION 00109 *=======================*/ 00110 00111 /*------------- 00112 * Drawing 00113 *-----------*/ 00114 00115 /*Enable complex draw engine. 00116 *Required to draw shadow, gradient, rounded corners, circles, arc, skew lines, image transformations or any masks*/ 00117 #define LV_DRAW_COMPLEX 1 00118 #if LV_DRAW_COMPLEX != 0 00119 00120 /*Allow buffering some shadow calculation. 00121 *LV_SHADOW_CACHE_SIZE is the max. shadow size to buffer, where shadow size is `shadow_width + radius` 00122 *Caching has LV_SHADOW_CACHE_SIZE^2 RAM cost*/ 00123 #define LV_SHADOW_CACHE_SIZE 0 00124 00125 /* Set number of maximally cached circle data. 00126 * The circumference of 1/4 circle are saved for anti-aliasing 00127 * radius * 4 bytes are used per circle (the most often used radiuses are saved) 00128 * 0: to disable caching */ 00129 #define LV_CIRCLE_CACHE_SIZE 4 00130 #endif /*LV_DRAW_COMPLEX*/ 00131 00145 #define LV_LAYER_SIMPLE_BUF_SIZE (24 * 1024) 00146 #define LV_LAYER_SIMPLE_FALLBACK_BUF_SIZE (3 * 1024) 00147 00148 /*Default image cache size. Image caching keeps the images opened. 00149 *If only the built-in image formats are used there is no real advantage of caching. (I.e. if no new image decoder is added) 00150 *With complex image decoders (e.g. PNG or JPG) caching can save the continuous open/decode of images. 00151 *However the opened images might consume additional RAM. 00152 *0: to disable caching*/ 00153 #define LV_IMG_CACHE_DEF_SIZE 0 00154 00155 /*Number of stops allowed per gradient. Increase this to allow more stops. 00156 *This adds (sizeof(lv_color_t) + 1) bytes per additional stop*/ 00157 #define LV_GRADIENT_MAX_STOPS 2 00158 00159 /*Default gradient buffer size. 00160 *When LVGL calculates the gradient "maps" it can save them into a cache to avoid calculating them again. 00161 *LV_GRAD_CACHE_DEF_SIZE sets the size of this cache in bytes. 00162 *If the cache is too small the map will be allocated only while it's required for the drawing. 00163 *0 mean no caching.*/ 00164 #define LV_GRAD_CACHE_DEF_SIZE 0 00165 00166 /*Allow dithering the gradients (to achieve visual smooth color gradients on limited color depth display) 00167 *LV_DITHER_GRADIENT implies allocating one or two more lines of the object's rendering surface 00168 *The increase in memory consumption is (32 bits * object width) plus 24 bits * object width if using error diffusion */ 00169 #define LV_DITHER_GRADIENT 0 00170 #if LV_DITHER_GRADIENT 00171 /*Add support for error diffusion dithering. 00172 *Error diffusion dithering gets a much better visual result, but implies more CPU consumption and memory when drawing. 00173 *The increase in memory consumption is (24 bits * object's width)*/ 00174 #define LV_DITHER_ERROR_DIFFUSION 0 00175 #endif 00176 00177 /*Maximum buffer size to allocate for rotation. 00178 *Only used if software rotation is enabled in the display driver.*/ 00179 #define LV_DISP_ROT_MAX_BUF (10*1024) 00180 00181 /*------------- 00182 * GPU 00183 *-----------*/ 00184 00185 /*Use Arm's 2D acceleration library Arm-2D */ 00186 #define LV_USE_GPU_ARM2D 0 00187 00188 /*Use STM32's DMA2D (aka Chrom Art) GPU*/ 00189 #define LV_USE_GPU_STM32_DMA2D 0 00190 #if LV_USE_GPU_STM32_DMA2D 00191 /*Must be defined to include path of CMSIS header of target processor 00192 e.g. "stm32f769xx.h" or "stm32f429xx.h"*/ 00193 #define LV_GPU_DMA2D_CMSIS_INCLUDE 00194 #endif 00195 00196 /*Use SWM341's DMA2D GPU*/ 00197 #define LV_USE_GPU_SWM341_DMA2D 0 00198 #if LV_USE_GPU_SWM341_DMA2D 00199 #define LV_GPU_SWM341_DMA2D_INCLUDE "SWM341.h" 00200 #endif 00201 00202 /*Use NXP's PXP GPU iMX RTxxx platforms*/ 00203 #define LV_USE_GPU_NXP_PXP 0 00204 #if LV_USE_GPU_NXP_PXP 00205 /*1: Add default bare metal and FreeRTOS interrupt handling routines for PXP (lv_gpu_nxp_pxp_osa.c) 00206 * and call lv_gpu_nxp_pxp_init() automatically during lv_init(). Note that symbol SDK_OS_FREE_RTOS 00207 * has to be defined in order to use FreeRTOS OSA, otherwise bare-metal implementation is selected. 00208 *0: lv_gpu_nxp_pxp_init() has to be called manually before lv_init() 00209 */ 00210 #define LV_USE_GPU_NXP_PXP_AUTO_INIT 0 00211 #endif 00212 00213 /*Use NXP's VG-Lite GPU iMX RTxxx platforms*/ 00214 #define LV_USE_GPU_NXP_VG_LITE 0 00215 00216 /*Use SDL renderer API*/ 00217 #define LV_USE_GPU_SDL 0 00218 #if LV_USE_GPU_SDL 00219 #define LV_GPU_SDL_INCLUDE_PATH <SDL2/SDL.h> 00220 /*Texture cache size, 8MB by default*/ 00221 #define LV_GPU_SDL_LRU_SIZE (1024 * 1024 * 8) 00222 /*Custom blend mode for mask drawing, disable if you need to link with older SDL2 lib*/ 00223 #define LV_GPU_SDL_CUSTOM_BLEND_MODE (SDL_VERSION_ATLEAST(2, 0, 6)) 00224 #endif 00225 00226 /*------------- 00227 * Logging 00228 *-----------*/ 00229 00230 /*Enable the log module*/ 00231 #define LV_USE_LOG 0 00232 #if LV_USE_LOG 00233 00234 /*How important log should be added: 00235 *LV_LOG_LEVEL_TRACE A lot of logs to give detailed information 00236 *LV_LOG_LEVEL_INFO Log important events 00237 *LV_LOG_LEVEL_WARN Log if something unwanted happened but didn't cause a problem 00238 *LV_LOG_LEVEL_ERROR Only critical issue, when the system may fail 00239 *LV_LOG_LEVEL_USER Only logs added by the user 00240 *LV_LOG_LEVEL_NONE Do not log anything*/ 00241 #define LV_LOG_LEVEL LV_LOG_LEVEL_WARN 00242 00243 /*1: Print the log with 'printf'; 00244 *0: User need to register a callback with `lv_log_register_print_cb()`*/ 00245 #define LV_LOG_PRINTF 0 00246 00247 /*Enable/disable LV_LOG_TRACE in modules that produces a huge number of logs*/ 00248 #define LV_LOG_TRACE_MEM 1 00249 #define LV_LOG_TRACE_TIMER 1 00250 #define LV_LOG_TRACE_INDEV 1 00251 #define LV_LOG_TRACE_DISP_REFR 1 00252 #define LV_LOG_TRACE_EVENT 1 00253 #define LV_LOG_TRACE_OBJ_CREATE 1 00254 #define LV_LOG_TRACE_LAYOUT 1 00255 #define LV_LOG_TRACE_ANIM 1 00256 00257 #endif /*LV_USE_LOG*/ 00258 00259 /*------------- 00260 * Asserts 00261 *-----------*/ 00262 00263 /*Enable asserts if an operation is failed or an invalid data is found. 00264 *If LV_USE_LOG is enabled an error message will be printed on failure*/ 00265 #define LV_USE_ASSERT_NULL 1 /*Check if the parameter is NULL. (Very fast, recommended)*/ 00266 #define LV_USE_ASSERT_MALLOC 1 /*Checks is the memory is successfully allocated or no. (Very fast, recommended)*/ 00267 #define LV_USE_ASSERT_STYLE 0 /*Check if the styles are properly initialized. (Very fast, recommended)*/ 00268 #define LV_USE_ASSERT_MEM_INTEGRITY 0 /*Check the integrity of `lv_mem` after critical operations. (Slow)*/ 00269 #define LV_USE_ASSERT_OBJ 0 /*Check the object's type and existence (e.g. not deleted). (Slow)*/ 00270 00271 /*Add a custom handler when assert happens e.g. to restart the MCU*/ 00272 #define LV_ASSERT_HANDLER_INCLUDE <stdint.h> 00273 #define LV_ASSERT_HANDLER while(1); /*Halt by default*/ 00274 00275 /*------------- 00276 * Others 00277 *-----------*/ 00278 00279 /*1: Show CPU usage and FPS count*/ 00280 #define LV_USE_PERF_MONITOR 0 00281 #if LV_USE_PERF_MONITOR 00282 #define LV_USE_PERF_MONITOR_POS LV_ALIGN_BOTTOM_RIGHT 00283 #endif 00284 00285 /*1: Show the used memory and the memory fragmentation 00286 * Requires LV_MEM_CUSTOM = 0*/ 00287 #define LV_USE_MEM_MONITOR 0 00288 #if LV_USE_MEM_MONITOR 00289 #define LV_USE_MEM_MONITOR_POS LV_ALIGN_BOTTOM_LEFT 00290 #endif 00291 00292 /*1: Draw random colored rectangles over the redrawn areas*/ 00293 #define LV_USE_REFR_DEBUG 0 00294 00295 /*Change the built in (v)snprintf functions*/ 00296 #define LV_SPRINTF_CUSTOM 0 00297 #if LV_SPRINTF_CUSTOM 00298 #define LV_SPRINTF_INCLUDE <stdio.h> 00299 #define lv_snprintf snprintf 00300 #define lv_vsnprintf vsnprintf 00301 #else /*LV_SPRINTF_CUSTOM*/ 00302 #define LV_SPRINTF_USE_FLOAT 0 00303 #endif /*LV_SPRINTF_CUSTOM*/ 00304 00305 #define LV_USE_USER_DATA 1 00306 00307 /*Garbage Collector settings 00308 *Used if lvgl is bound to higher level language and the memory is managed by that language*/ 00309 #define LV_ENABLE_GC 0 00310 #if LV_ENABLE_GC != 0 00311 #define LV_GC_INCLUDE "gc.h" /*Include Garbage Collector related things*/ 00312 #endif /*LV_ENABLE_GC*/ 00313 00314 /*===================== 00315 * COMPILER SETTINGS 00316 *====================*/ 00317 00318 /*For big endian systems set to 1*/ 00319 #define LV_BIG_ENDIAN_SYSTEM 0 00320 00321 /*Define a custom attribute to `lv_tick_inc` function*/ 00322 #define LV_ATTRIBUTE_TICK_INC 00323 00324 /*Define a custom attribute to `lv_timer_handler` function*/ 00325 #define LV_ATTRIBUTE_TIMER_HANDLER 00326 00327 /*Define a custom attribute to `lv_disp_flush_ready` function*/ 00328 #define LV_ATTRIBUTE_FLUSH_READY 00329 00330 /*Required alignment size for buffers*/ 00331 #define LV_ATTRIBUTE_MEM_ALIGN_SIZE 1 00332 00333 /*Will be added where memories needs to be aligned (with -Os data might not be aligned to boundary by default). 00334 * E.g. __attribute__((aligned(4)))*/ 00335 #define LV_ATTRIBUTE_MEM_ALIGN 00336 00337 /*Attribute to mark large constant arrays for example font's bitmaps*/ 00338 #define LV_ATTRIBUTE_LARGE_CONST 00339 00340 /*Compiler prefix for a big array declaration in RAM*/ 00341 #define LV_ATTRIBUTE_LARGE_RAM_ARRAY 00342 00343 /*Place performance critical functions into a faster memory (e.g RAM)*/ 00344 #define LV_ATTRIBUTE_FAST_MEM 00345 00346 /*Prefix variables that are used in GPU accelerated operations, often these need to be placed in RAM sections that are DMA accessible*/ 00347 #define LV_ATTRIBUTE_DMA 00348 00349 /*Export integer constant to binding. This macro is used with constants in the form of LV_<CONST> that 00350 *should also appear on LVGL binding API such as Micropython.*/ 00351 #define LV_EXPORT_CONST_INT(int_value) struct _silence_gcc_warning /*The default value just prevents GCC warning*/ 00352 00353 /*Extend the default -32k..32k coordinate range to -4M..4M by using int32_t for coordinates instead of int16_t*/ 00354 #define LV_USE_LARGE_COORD 0 00355 00356 /*================== 00357 * FONT USAGE 00358 *===================*/ 00359 00360 /*Montserrat fonts with ASCII range and some symbols using bpp = 4 00361 *https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Montserrat*/ 00362 #define LV_FONT_MONTSERRAT_8 0 00363 #define LV_FONT_MONTSERRAT_10 0 00364 #define LV_FONT_MONTSERRAT_12 1 00365 #define LV_FONT_MONTSERRAT_14 1 00366 #define LV_FONT_MONTSERRAT_16 1 00367 #define LV_FONT_MONTSERRAT_18 0 00368 #define LV_FONT_MONTSERRAT_20 1 00369 #define LV_FONT_MONTSERRAT_22 0 00370 #define LV_FONT_MONTSERRAT_24 0 00371 #define LV_FONT_MONTSERRAT_26 1 00372 #define LV_FONT_MONTSERRAT_28 0 00373 #define LV_FONT_MONTSERRAT_30 0 00374 #define LV_FONT_MONTSERRAT_32 1 00375 #define LV_FONT_MONTSERRAT_34 0 00376 #define LV_FONT_MONTSERRAT_36 0 00377 #define LV_FONT_MONTSERRAT_38 0 00378 #define LV_FONT_MONTSERRAT_40 0 00379 #define LV_FONT_MONTSERRAT_42 0 00380 #define LV_FONT_MONTSERRAT_44 0 00381 #define LV_FONT_MONTSERRAT_46 0 00382 #define LV_FONT_MONTSERRAT_48 0 00383 00384 /*Demonstrate special features*/ 00385 #define LV_FONT_MONTSERRAT_12_SUBPX 0 00386 #define LV_FONT_MONTSERRAT_28_COMPRESSED 0 /*bpp = 3*/ 00387 #define LV_FONT_DEJAVU_16_PERSIAN_HEBREW 0 /*Hebrew, Arabic, Persian letters and all their forms*/ 00388 #define LV_FONT_SIMSUN_16_CJK 0 /*1000 most common CJK radicals*/ 00389 00390 /*Pixel perfect monospace fonts*/ 00391 #define LV_FONT_UNSCII_8 0 00392 #define LV_FONT_UNSCII_16 0 00393 00394 /*Optionally declare custom fonts here. 00395 *You can use these fonts as default font too and they will be available globally. 00396 *E.g. #define LV_FONT_CUSTOM_DECLARE LV_FONT_DECLARE(my_font_1) LV_FONT_DECLARE(my_font_2)*/ 00397 #define LV_FONT_CUSTOM_DECLARE 00398 00399 /*Always set a default font*/ 00400 #define LV_FONT_DEFAULT &lv_font_montserrat_14 00401 00402 /*Enable handling large font and/or fonts with a lot of characters. 00403 *The limit depends on the font size, font face and bpp. 00404 *Compiler error will be triggered if a font needs it.*/ 00405 #define LV_FONT_FMT_TXT_LARGE 0 00406 00407 /*Enables/disables support for compressed fonts.*/ 00408 #define LV_USE_FONT_COMPRESSED 0 00409 00410 /*Enable subpixel rendering*/ 00411 #define LV_USE_FONT_SUBPX 0 00412 #if LV_USE_FONT_SUBPX 00413 /*Set the pixel order of the display. Physical order of RGB channels. Doesn't matter with "normal" fonts.*/ 00414 #define LV_FONT_SUBPX_BGR 0 /*0: RGB; 1:BGR order*/ 00415 #endif 00416 00417 /*Enable drawing placeholders when glyph dsc is not found*/ 00418 #define LV_USE_FONT_PLACEHOLDER 1 00419 00420 /*================= 00421 * TEXT SETTINGS 00422 *=================*/ 00423 00430 #define LV_TXT_ENC LV_TXT_ENC_UTF8 00431 00432 /*Can break (wrap) texts on these chars*/ 00433 #define LV_TXT_BREAK_CHARS " ,.;:-_" 00434 00435 /*If a word is at least this long, will break wherever "prettiest" 00436 *To disable, set to a value <= 0*/ 00437 #define LV_TXT_LINE_BREAK_LONG_LEN 0 00438 00439 /*Minimum number of characters in a long word to put on a line before a break. 00440 *Depends on LV_TXT_LINE_BREAK_LONG_LEN.*/ 00441 #define LV_TXT_LINE_BREAK_LONG_PRE_MIN_LEN 3 00442 00443 /*Minimum number of characters in a long word to put on a line after a break. 00444 *Depends on LV_TXT_LINE_BREAK_LONG_LEN.*/ 00445 #define LV_TXT_LINE_BREAK_LONG_POST_MIN_LEN 3 00446 00447 /*The control character to use for signalling text recoloring.*/ 00448 #define LV_TXT_COLOR_CMD "#" 00449 00450 /*Support bidirectional texts. Allows mixing Left-to-Right and Right-to-Left texts. 00451 *The direction will be processed according to the Unicode Bidirectional Algorithm: 00452 *https://www.w3.org/International/articles/inline-bidi-markup/uba-basics*/ 00453 #define LV_USE_BIDI 0 00454 #if LV_USE_BIDI 00455 /*Set the default direction. Supported values: 00456 *`LV_BASE_DIR_LTR` Left-to-Right 00457 *`LV_BASE_DIR_RTL` Right-to-Left 00458 *`LV_BASE_DIR_AUTO` detect texts base direction*/ 00459 #define LV_BIDI_BASE_DIR_DEF LV_BASE_DIR_AUTO 00460 #endif 00461 00462 /*Enable Arabic/Persian processing 00463 *In these languages characters should be replaced with an other form based on their position in the text*/ 00464 #define LV_USE_ARABIC_PERSIAN_CHARS 0 00465 00466 /*================== 00467 * WIDGET USAGE 00468 *================*/ 00469 00470 /*Documentation of the widgets: https://docs.lvgl.io/latest/en/html/widgets/index.html*/ 00471 00472 #define LV_USE_ARC 1 00473 00474 #define LV_USE_BAR 1 00475 00476 #define LV_USE_BTN 1 00477 00478 #define LV_USE_BTNMATRIX 1 00479 00480 #define LV_USE_CANVAS 1 00481 00482 #define LV_USE_CHECKBOX 1 00483 00484 #define LV_USE_DROPDOWN 1 /*Requires: lv_label*/ 00485 00486 #define LV_USE_IMG 1 /*Requires: lv_label*/ 00487 00488 #define LV_USE_LABEL 1 00489 #if LV_USE_LABEL 00490 #define LV_LABEL_TEXT_SELECTION 1 /*Enable selecting text of the label*/ 00491 #define LV_LABEL_LONG_TXT_HINT 1 /*Store some extra info in labels to speed up drawing of very long texts*/ 00492 #endif 00493 00494 #define LV_USE_LINE 1 00495 00496 #define LV_USE_ROLLER 1 /*Requires: lv_label*/ 00497 #if LV_USE_ROLLER 00498 #define #define LV_USE_TEXTAREA 1 /*Requires: lv_label*/ 00506 #if LV_USE_TEXTAREA != 0 00507 #define LV_TEXTAREA_DEF_PWD_SHOW_TIME 1500 /*ms*/ 00508 #endif 00509 00510 #define LV_USE_TABLE 1 00511 00512 library*/ 00644 #define LV_USE_BMP 0 00645 00646 /* JPG + split JPG decoder library. 00647 * Split JPG is a custom format optimized for embedded systems. */ 00648 #define LV_USE_SJPG 0 00649 00650 /*GIF decoder library*/ 00651 #define LV_USE_GIF 0 00652 00653 /*QR code library*/ 00654 #define LV_USE_QRCODE 0 00655 00656 /*FreeType library*/ 00657 #define LV_USE_FREETYPE 0 00658 #if LV_USE_FREETYPE 00659 /*Memory used by FreeType to cache characters [bytes] (-1: no caching)*/ 00660 #define LV_FREETYPE_CACHE_SIZE (16 * 1024) 00661 #if LV_FREETYPE_CACHE_SIZE >= 0 00662 /* 1: bitmap cache use the sbit cache, 0:bitmap cache use the image cache. */ 00663 /* sbit cache:it is much more memory efficient for small bitmaps(font size < 256) */ 00664 /* if font size >= 256, must be configured as image cache */ 00665 #define LV_FREETYPE_SBIT_CACHE 0 00666 /* Maximum number of opened FT_Face/FT_Size objects managed by this cache instance. */ 00667 /* (0:use system defaults) */ 00668 #define LV_FREETYPE_CACHE_FT_FACES 0 00669 #define LV_FREETYPE_CACHE_FT_SIZES 0 00670 #endif 00671 #endif 00672 00673 /*Rlottie library*/ 00674 #define LV_USE_RLOTTIE 0 00675 00676 /*FFmpeg library for image decoding and playing videos 00677 *Supports all major image formats so do not enable other image decoder with it*/ 00678 #define LV_USE_FFMPEG 0 00679 #if LV_USE_FFMPEG 00680 /*Dump input information to stderr*/ 00681 #define LV_FFMPEG_DUMP_FORMAT 0 00682 #endif 00683 00684 /*----------- 00685 * Others 00686 *----------*/ 00687 00688 /*1: Enable API to take snapshot for object*/ 00689 #define LV_USE_SNAPSHOT 0 00690 00691 /*1: Enable Monkey test*/ 00692 #define LV_USE_MONKEY 0 00693 00694 /*1: Enable grid navigation*/ 00695 #define LV_USE_GRIDNAV 0 00696 00697 /*1: Enable lv_obj fragment*/ 00698 #define LV_USE_FRAGMENT 0 00699 00700 /*1: Support using images as font in label or span widgets */ 00701 #define LV_USE_IMGFONT 0 00702 00703 /*1: Enable a published subscriber based messaging system */ 00704 #define LV_USE_MSG 0 00705 00706 /*1: Enable Pinyin input method*/ 00707 /*Requires: lv_keyboard*/ 00708 #define LV_USE_IME_PINYIN 0 00709 #if LV_USE_IME_PINYIN 00710 /*1: Use default thesaurus*/ 00711 /*If you do not use the default thesaurus, be sure to use `lv_ime_pinyin` after setting the thesauruss*/ 00712 #define LV_IME_PINYIN_USE_DEFAULT_DICT 1 00713 /*Set the maximum number of candidate panels that can be displayed*/ 00714 /*This needs to be adjusted according to the size of the screen*/ 00715 #define LV_IME_PINYIN_CAND_TEXT_NUM 6 00716 00717 /*Use 9 key input(k9)*/ 00718 #define LV_IME_PINYIN_USE_K9_MODE 1 00719 #if LV_IME_PINYIN_USE_K9_MODE == 1 00720 #define LV_IME_PINYIN_K9_CAND_TEXT_NUM 3 00721 #endif // LV_IME_PINYIN_USE_K9_MODE 00722 #endif 00723 00724 /*================== 00725 * EXAMPLES 00726 *==================*/ 00727 00728 /*Enable the examples to be built with the library*/ 00729 #define LV_BUILD_EXAMPLES 1 00730 00731 /*=================== 00732 * DEMO USAGE 00733 ====================*/ 00734 00735 /*Show some widget. It might be required to increase `LV_MEM_SIZE` */ 00736 #define LV_USE_DEMO_WIDGETS 1 00737 #if LV_USE_DEMO_WIDGETS 00738 #define LV_DEMO_WIDGETS_SLIDESHOW 0 00739 #endif 00740 00741 /*Demonstrate the usage of encoder and keyboard*/ 00742 #define LV_USE_DEMO_KEYPAD_AND_ENCODER 1 00743 00744 /*Benchmark your system*/ 00745 #define LV_USE_DEMO_BENCHMARK 1 00746 #if LV_USE_DEMO_BENCHMARK 00747 /*Use RGB565A8 images with 16 bit color depth instead of ARGB8565*/ 00748 #define LV_DEMO_BENCHMARK_RGB565A8 0 00749 #endif 00750 00751 /*Stress test for LVGL*/ 00752 #define LV_USE_DEMO_STRESS 1 00753 00754 /*Music player demo*/ 00755 #define LV_USE_DEMO_MUSIC 1 00756 #if LV_USE_DEMO_MUSIC 00757 #define LV_DEMO_MUSIC_SQUARE 0 00758 #define LV_DEMO_MUSIC_LANDSCAPE 0 00759 #define LV_DEMO_MUSIC_ROUND 0 00760 #define LV_DEMO_MUSIC_LARGE 0 00761 #define LV_DEMO_MUSIC_AUTO_PLAY 0 00762 #endif 00763 00764 /*--END OF LV_CONF_H--*/ 00765 00766 #endif /*LV_CONF_H*/ 00767 00768 #endif /*End of "Content enable"*/
